subject: Ask Haptic module
description_text: Hello, I already wrote to you this week with a few questions about the Pro X Ultra pedal set, and now I have one last question before ordering this week, it's about the Haptic Reactor module. I'm looking for both feel, but without it being too much and ESPECIALLY not being too noisy. Which model do you recommend? I think that for my needs, the Haptic VAM Rumble are the best for me? Can you confirm?

conversations.body_text: Hi Mattéo Perrin,    You may opt for the VAM Rumble, which produces less noise and is perfectly adequate. However, the VAM Pro, when mounted horizontally, also generates minimal noise while offering superior build quality and feedback. You may select the model that best suits your requirements.  Additionally, you may avail yourself of our shop discount to enjoy a $35 reduction on the $199 price: CNFRCS  https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-pro-x-ultra-pedal-with-haptics

Well, that's too much, I'm going to take the time to think about it, I'm going to order on Wednesday normally so I have 2 short days to think about it ahah, and to mount them horizontally we have to make supports ourselves in 3D printing, is that it for the VAM pro?
